concept.title: New features
concept.shortdesc: New features added to in the 1.x release series.

section.title: catch_errors function (1.23.0)
section.p: The new plan function, catch_errors, accepts a list of types of errors to catch and a block of code to run where, if it errors, the plan continues executing. (BOLT-1316)

section.title: baseurl setting in puppetfile config (1.23.0)
section.p: The puppetfile config section now supports a subsection that you can use to set an alternate location from which to download modules. (BOLT-1376)

section.title: Proxy configuration (1.22.0)
section.p: You can now specify an HTTP proxy for bolt puppetfile install in bolt.yaml, for example: puppetfile: proxy: https://proxy.example.com(BOLT-1327)

section.title: Support for version 4 Terraform state files (1.22.0)
section.p: Target-lookups using the Terraform plugin are now compatible with the version 4 Terraform state files generated by Terraform version 0.12.x. (BOLT-1341)

section.title: Prompt for sensitive data from inventory v2 (1.22.0)
section.p: A new prompt plugin in inventory v2 allows setting configuration values via a prompt. (BOLT-1269)

section.title: Set custom exec commands for Docker transport (1.21.0)
section.p: New configuration options, shell-command and tty, for the Docker transport allow setting custom Docker exec commands.

section.title: Check existence and readability of files (1.21.0)
section.p: New functions, file::exists and file::readable, test whether a given file exists and is readable, respectively. (BOLT-1338)

section.title: Output a message (1.21.0)
section.p: The new out::message() function can be used to print a message to the user during a plan. (BOLT-1325)

section.title: Return a filtered ResultSet with a ResultSet (1.21.0)
section.p: A new filter_set function in the ResultSet data type filters a ResultSet with a lambda to return a ResultSet object. (BOLT-1337)

section.title: Improved error handling for unreadable private keys (1.21.0)
section.p: A more specific warning is now surfaced when an SSH private key can't be read from configuration. (BOLT-1297)

section.title: Look up facts in inventory v2 (1.21.0)
section.p: The plugin can now be used to look up configuration values from facts for the name, uri, and config inventory options for each target. (BOLT-1264)

section.title: Terraform plugin in inventory v2 (1.20.0)
section.p: A new plugin in inventory v2 loads Terraform state and map resource properties to target parameters. This plugin enables using a Terraform projectto dynamically determine the targets to use when running . (BOLT-1265)

section.title: Type info available in plans (1.20.0)
section.p: A new to_data method is available for plan result objects that provides a hash representation of the object. (BOLT-1223)

section.title: Improved logging for apply (1.20.0)
section.p: The apply command and the apply function from plans now show log messages for changes and failures that happened while applying code. (BOLT-901)

section.title: Convert YAML plans to plans (1.19.0)
section.p: You can now convert YAML plans to plans with the bolt plan convert command. (BOLT-1195)

section.title: Improved error handling for missing commands (1.19.0)
section.p: A clear error message is now shown when no object is specified on the command line, for example bolt command run --nodes <NODE_NAME>. (BOLT-1243)

section.title: Inventory file version 2 (1.18.0)
section.p: An updated version of the inventory file, version 2, is now available for experimentation and testing. In addition to several syntax changes, this version enables setting a human readable name for nodes and dynamically populating groups from queries. This version of the inventory file is still in development and might experience breaking changes in future releases. ( BOLT-1232)

section.title: YAML plan validation (1.18.0)
section.p: YAML plan validation now alerts on syntax errors before plan execution. (BOLT-1194)

section.title: Rerun failed commands (1.17.0)
section.p: now stores information about the last failed run in a .rerun.json file in the project directory. You can use this record to target nodes for the next run using --retry failure instead of --nodes.
For repositories that contain a project directory, add $boltdir/.last_failure.json to .gitignore files.
Stored information may include passwords, so if you save passwords in URIs, set save-failures: false in your config file to avoid writing passwords to the .rerun.json file. ( BOLT-843)

section.title: Packaged hiera-eyaml gem (1.16.0)
section.p: packages now include the hiera-eyaml gem. ( BOLT-1026)

section.title: Local transport options for run-as, run-as-command, and sudo-password (1.16.0)
section.p: The local transport now accepts the run-as, run-as-command, and sudo-password options on non- nodes. These options escalate the system user (who ran bolt) to the specified user, and behave like the same options using the SSH transport. _run_as can also be configured for individual plan function calls for the local transport. ( BOLT-1052)

section.title: Localhost target applies the puppet-agent feature (1.16.0)
section.p: When the target hostname is localhost, the puppet-agent feature is automatically added to the target, because the agent installed with is present on the local system. This functionality is available on all transports, not just the local transport. ( BOLT-1200)

section.title: Tasks use the interpreter only for localhost (1.16.0)
section.p: Bolt sets its own installed as the default interpreter for all .rb scripts running on localhost. Previously, this default was used on all commands run over the local transport; it's now used when the hostname is localhost regardless of the transport. ( BOLT-1205)

section.title: Fact indicates whether is compiling a catalog (1.16.0)
section.p: If is compiling a catalog, $facts['bolt'] is set to true, allowing you to determine whether modules are being used from a catalog. ( BOLT-1199)

section.title: YAML plans (1.15.0)
section.p: You can now write plans in the YAML language. YAML plans run a list of steps in order, which allows you to define simple workflows. Steps can contain embedded Puppet code expressions to add logic where necessary. For more details about YAML plans, see . For an example of a YAML plan in use, see the Puppet blog. ( BOLT-1150)
This version also adds analytics data collection about the number of steps and the return type of YAML plans. ( BOLT-1193)

section.title: Support for 8 (1.15.0)
section.p: A package is now available for 8. ( BOLT-1204)

section.title: Improved load time (1.15.0)
section.p: startup is now more efficient. ( BOLT-1119)

section.title: Details about Result and ResultSet objects (1.15.0)
section.p: The Result and ResultSet objects now include information in the JSON output about the action that generated the result. ( BOLT-1125)

section.title: Inventory warning about unexepected keys (1.15.0)
section.p: An informative warning message is now logged when invalid group or node configuration keys are detected in the inventoryfile. ( BOLT-1017)

section.title: BoltSpec::Run support for uploading files to remote systems (1.15.0)
section.p: BoltSpec::Run now supports the upload_file action. ( BOLT-953)

section.title: Support for device modules in a manifest block (1.14.0)
section.p: You can now apply code on targets that can't run a agent using the remote transport via a proxy. This is an experimental feature and might change in future minor (y) releases. ( BOLT-645)

section.title: Validation and error handling for invalid PCP tokens (1.14.0)
section.p: The PCP transport token-file configuration option now includes validation and a more helpful error message. ( BOLT-1076)

section.title: SMB file transfer on (1.13.0)
section.p: When transferring files to a host, you can now optionally use the SMB protocol to reduce transfer time. You must have either administrative rights to use an administrative share, like \\host\C$, or use UNC style paths to access existing shares, like \\host\share. You can use SMB file transfers only over HTTP, not HTTPS, and SMB3, which supports encryption, is not yet supported. ( BOLT-153)

section.title: Interpreter configuration option (1.13.0)
section.p: An interpreters configuration option enables setting the interpreter that is used to execute a task based on file extension. This options lets you override the shebang defined in the task source code with the path to the executable on the remote system. ( BOLT-146)

conbody.section: Improved error handling (1.13.0)Clearer error messages now alert you when you use plan functions not meant to be called in apply blocks. (BOLT-1131)

section.title: Updated project directory structure (1.12.0)
section.p: Within your project directory, we now recommend using a directory called site-modules, instead of the more ambiguously named site, to contain any modules not intended to be managed with a Puppetfile. Both site-modules and site are included on the default modulepath to maintain backward compatibility. ( BOLT-1108)

section.title: bolt puppetfile show-modules command (1.12.0)
section.p: A new bolt puppetfile show-modules command lists the modules, and their versions, installed in the current Boltdir. ( BOLT-1118)

section.title: BoltSpec::Run helpers accept options consistently (1.12.0)
section.p: All BoltSpec::Run helpers now require the params or arguments argument to be passed. ( BOLT-1057)

section.title: bolt task show displays module path (1.11.0)
section.p: Task and plan list output now includes the module path to help you better understand why a task or plan is not included. ( BOLT-1027)

section.title: scripts over the transport (1.11.0)
section.p: You can now run scripts on targets over the transport. ( BOLT-830)

section.title: RSA keys with OpenSSH format (1.11.0)
section.p: RSA keys stored in the OpenSSH format can now be used for authentication with the SSH transport. ( BOLT-1124)

section.title: Support for new platforms (1.11.0)
section.p:
packages are now available for these platforms:
28 and 29 ( BOLT-978)
10.14 Mojave ( BOLT-1040)

conbody.section: Hyphens allowed in aliases and group names (1.10.0)Node aliases and group names in the Bolt inventory can now contain hyphens. (BOLT-1022)

section.title: Improved out-of-the-box tasks (1.9.0)
section.p: The package and service tasks now select task implementation based on available target features while their platform-specific implementations are private. ( BOLT-1049)

conbody.section: Respect multiple PuppetDB server_urls (1.9.0)Bolt now tries to connect to all configured PuppetDBserver_urls before failing. ( BOLT-938)

section.title: Standard library functions (1.8.0)
section.p:
Bolt now includes several standard library functions useful for writing plans, including:
ctrl::sleep
ctrl::do_until
file::read
file::write
system::env See for details. ( BOLT-1054)

section.title: Configure proxy SSH connections through jump hosts (1.7.0)
section.p: You can now configure proxy SSH connections through jump hosts from the inventory file with the proxyjump SSH configuration option. ( BOLT-1039)

section.title: Query resource states from a plan (1.7.0)
section.p: You can now query resource states from a plan with the get_resources function. ( BOLT-1035)

section.title: Specify an array of directories in modulepath (1.7.0)
section.p: You can now specify an array of directories for the modulepath setting in bolt.yaml, rather than just a string. This change enables using a single bolt.yaml on both and clients. ( BOLT-817)

section.title: Save keystrokes on modulepath, inventoryfile, and verbose (1.7.0)
section.p: You can now use shortened command options for modulepath (-m), inventoryfile (-i), and verbose (-v). ( BOLT-1047)

section.title: Remote tasks (1.6.0)
section.p: You can now run tasks on a proxy target that remotely interacts with the real target, as defined by the run-on option. Remote tasks are useful for targets like network devices that have limited shell environments, or cloud services driven only by HTTP APIs. Connection information for non-server targets, like HTTP endpoints, can be stored in inventory. ( BOLT-791)

section.title: reboot module plan (1.6.0)
section.p: Bolt now ships with the reboot module, and that module now provides a plan that reboots targets and waits for them to become available. ( BOLT-459)

section.title: Local transport on (1.6.0)
section.p: The local transport option is now supported on . ( BOLT-608)

section.title: bolt_shim module contents marked as sensitive (1.6.0)
section.p: The bolt_shim module that enables using with now marks file content as sensitive, preventing it from being logged or stored in a database. ( BOLT-815)

section.title: Node aliases (1.5.0)
section.p: You can now specify aliases for nodes in your inventory and then use the aliases to refer to specific nodes. ( BOLT-510)

section.title: Run apply with orchestrator without installing puppet_agent module (1.5.0)
section.p: no longer requires installing the puppet_agent module in in order to run apply actions with the orchestrator. ( BOLT-940)

section.title: apply with orchestrator (1.4.0)
section.p: A new puppetlabs-apply_helper module enables using apply with orchestrator. For details, see the module README. ( BOLT-941)

section.title: Add targets to a group (1.4.0)
section.p: A new add_to_group function allows you to add targets to an inventory group during plan execution. ( BOLT-942)

section.title: Additional plan test helpers (1.4.0)
section.p: The BoltSpec::Plans library now supports unit testing plans that use the _run_as parameter, apply, run_command, run_script, and upload_file. ( BOLT-984)

section.title: Data collection about applied catalogs (1.4.0)
section.p: If analytics data collection is enabled, we now collect randomized info about the number of statements in an apply block, and how many resources that produces for each target. ( BOLT-644)

section.title: Docker transport for running commands on containers (1.3.0)
section.p: A new Docker transport option enables running commands on container instances with the Docker API. The Docker transport is experimental because the capabilities and role of the Docker API might change.( BOLT-962)

section.title: Wait until all target nodes accept connections (1.3.0)
section.p: A new wait_until_available function waits until all targets are accepting connections, or triggers an error if the command times out. ( BOLT-956)

section.title: Apply manifest code with bolt apply command (1.2.0)
section.p: The command bolt apply has been added to apply manifest code on targets without wrapping them in an apply() block in a plan. This command is in development and subject to change. (BOLT-858)

section.title: Python and Ruby helper libraries for tasks (1.2.0)
section.p:
Two new libraries have been added to help you write tasks in Ruby and Python:
https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-ruby_task_helper
https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-python_task_helper
Use these libraries to parse task input, catch errors, and produce task output. For details, see Task Helpers. ( BOLT-906 and BOLT-907)

section.title: Redacted passwords for printed target objects (1.2.0)
section.p: When the Target object in a plan is printed, it includes only the host, user, port, and protocol used. The values for password and sudo-password are redacted. (BOLT-944)

section.title: Share code between tasks (1.1.0)
section.p: includes the ability to share code between tasks. A task can include a list of files that it requires, from any module, that it copies over and makes available via a _installdir parameter. This feature is also supported in 2019.0. For more information see, . ( BOLT-755)

section.title: Upgraded WinRM gem dependencies (1.1.0)
section.p:
The following gem dependencies have been upgraded to fix the connection between OMI server on Linux and the WinRM transport:
winrm 2.3.0
winrm-fs 1.3.1
json-schema 2.8.1 (BOLT-929)

section.title: Mark internal tasks as private (1.1.0)
section.p: In the task metadata, you can mark internal tasks as private and prevent them from appearing in task list UIs. ( BOLT-734)

section.title: Upload directories via plans (1.1.0)
section.p: The bolt file upload command and upload_file action now upload directories. For use over the PCP transport these commands require puppetlabs-bolt_shim 0.2.0 or later. ( BOLT-191)

section.title: Support for public-key signature system ed25519 (1.1.0)
section.p: The ed25519 key type is now supported out-of-the-box in packages. ( BOLT-380)
